summary: This is an FBI news briefing from November 24, 2020, covering various national and international news items. It includes a brief mention that Epstein prosecutors are seeking documents related to Glenn Dubin's children as part of the US Virgin Islands' racketeering probe into Jeffrey Epstein. The document also notes Ghislaine Maxwell was placed in quarantine after a jail staffer tested positive for COVID-19.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the late billionaire pedophile whose associates are being subpoenaed by the US Virgin Islands Attorney General in a racketeering probe.

persons.name: Glenn Dubin
persons.context: US Virgin Islands prosecutors are demanding he turn over all communications Epstein had with his three children via a subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Placed in quarantine after a staff member at the Metropolitan Detention Center in New York tested positive for COVID-19; she tested negative.

persons.name: Celina Dubin
persons.context: Epstein had openly declared plans to marry her; they developed a close relationship when she was 12, according to the Palm Beach Post.

persons.name: Maye Dubin
persons.context: Named in the subpoena seeking communications related to Glenn Dubin's children and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jordan Dubin
persons.context: Named in the subpoena seeking communications related to Glenn Dubin's children and Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Described as friends; Epstein had communications with Dubin's children, which are being sought by prosecutors.
Epstein had an 'especially close relationship' with Celina Dubin from age 12 and reportedly planned to marry her.
Maxwell is a co-defendant in the Epstein case, facing criminal charges related to his activities.

events.title: FBI News Briefing
events.description: Daily FBI news briefing covering various criminal investigations, counter-terrorism, and other national security matters.

events.title: Epstein Prosecutors Subpoena Dubin
events.description: US Virgin Islands prosecutors subpoena billionaire Glenn Dubin for all communications Jeffrey Epstein had with Dubin's three children as part of a racketeering probe.

events.title: Maxwell Placed in Quarantine
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell placed in quarantine at the Metropolitan Detention Center in New York after a jail staffer tested positive for COVID-19.

keyFacts: US Virgin Islands prosecutors are investigating alleged racketeering by Jeffrey Epstein and have issued subpoenas to associates including Glenn Dubin.
The subpoena to Glenn Dubin specifically seeks all documents and communications related to his three children (Maye, Celina, Jordan) that also relate to Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein had reportedly declared plans to marry Celina Dubin and had a close relationship with her from age 12.
Ghislaine Maxwell was placed in a 14-day quarantine after a jail staffer tested positive for COVID-19, though she tested negative.
The document is an FBI news briefing, indicating the Epstein case remains an active topic within law enforcement and intelligence circles.
